content.description:
Sur Les Pointes ascends a diagonal rail made of quality stone over a great landing.

Stand start with a left hand underling and a right hand three-finger edge. From there, move up to the rail, then traverse left using the remaining rail and sidepulls to reach a solid topout.
content.protection: A few pads would be good, the immediate landing is quite good.
content.location: It climbs the northwest face of Gyrus.

content.description: Stand start with a left hand on the arete and a right hand on a sidepull on the face. From there, work the feet up the thin edges, bump the left hand up the arete, then move to the lip, and top it out.
content.protection: A pad will suffice, the landing is very good.
content.location: It climbs the northwest face of Gyrus.

content.description:
Clairaudience climbs a vertical face on solid edges.

Stand start with hands matched on the edge about six feet off the deck. From there, make a big move to a two/three-finger edge with thumb catch, reach a left hand edge then the lip, and top out.
content.protection: A pad or two will work fine, the landing is good, but there is a rock behind the fall zone.
content.location: It climbs the northwest face of Gyrus.
